page.title: 02VIEWS ABOUT BLACK TORRINGTON
page.content: Black Torrington has seen vast social and economic changes over the years. Mechanisation of farms has almost eliminated farm workers and, with the trend to smaller families,has caused a sharp decline in the population, especially among young people. The school is one third of its former size and may eventually close. The main street is little changed but most old houses are modernised. Dramatic wage increases and modern facilities have led to a vastly higher standard of living, but the butcher, cobbler,baker blacksmith,tailor,dentist,wheelwright, one inn,one grocer and the local policeman have disappeared. Most villagers are satisfied with existing amenities, though some advocate more street lights, buses and facilities for the young.They felt that remaining businesses would probably survive.
